intro: Crescentia auculeata, commonly known as the sweet sop or custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a flowering plant in the family Bombacaceae, characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a fleshy, spiny fruit that contains a sweet, creamy pulp surrounding black, inedible seeds. Crescentia auculeata thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its edible fruit and ornamental value. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to tropical environments and suitable for both agricultural and horticultural use.
